alert.note: Alert for Gaston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 11:51AM EDT until April 29 at 12:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County... ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River At Lowell. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Between 10 and 11 feet, Floodwaters are in Riverside Park in Cramerton and in Goat Island Park. Floodwaters are approaching Riverside Dr near 5th and 6th Streets in Cramerton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Friday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of near 11.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
